Tabs

Tabs can be used to allow users to switch between different sets of information on the same page or in the same window. They are ideally used when switching between 3-5 sets of information, but can be modified to accommodate more.

Example

${require('html-loader?interpolate!../../partials/toggles.html')}

Large Tabs

Large tabs are intended to be used when switching views at the page level.

  • Home
  • Profile
  • Contact
  • Example 1
  • Example 2

Medium Tabs

Medium tabs are intended to be used when switching within a section of a page. There may be multiple sections within a page that use tabs.

  • Home
  • Profile
  • Contact

Guidelines

  • Keep tab labels short and limited to two words. Keep in mind mobile device screen width will be limited, and longer titles or large numbers of tabs will be hidden under a “More” menu. If you find yourself unable create succinct tab labels, then tabs are likely not the correct UI element for the use case.
  • Use tabs when you need content to be easily scannable and easy to navigate.
  • Tabs should not be used when there is more value in seeing the related content all at once, or when you want to encourage scrolling and discovery, in cases such as a product page or e-commerce site.
  • Tabs should not be used when content is sequential, or if users are seeking answers or guidance for support websites.

Documentation

Modifiers

Class Description
.uxf-nav-tabs-white-bg add class to ul.nav.nav-tabs element when using tabs where the body content has a white background
.uxf-nav-tabs-medium add class to ul.nav.nav-tabs element to apply medium tab styles

Javascript

Tabs use Bootstrap's tabs plugin and the Bootstrap Responsive Tabs library. Both libraries are included in UXFrame.

Convert from UXFrame v1 to v2 with .uxf-2018 Class

  1. Remove .set-first.large-tabs class from div.tabs
  2. Remove div.tabs element that surrounds the tabs ul
  3. Change li .selected to li .active
  4. Change div .tab-content to div .tab-pane
  5. Change the div .panel that surrounds the .tab-pane divs to div .tab-content
  6. Surround ul.nav.nav-tabs with div.tabs-container
  7. Add .nav.nav-tabs to the ul element
  8. Add .active to the default selected .tab-pane and the li that surrounds the default tab
  9. Add data-toggle="tab" to each tab's li > a
  10. Add role="tablist to ul.nav.nav-tabs
  11. If your tabs didn't have the .large-tabs class, add .uxf-nav-tabs-medium to div.tabs > ul
